CatDescriptText: John Smart, laborer, East Liberty and Leon Thomas, Terrace Village, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 29, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think there is too much emphasis placed on sports in high school and college?"  Mr. Smart's answer reads: "I think there is because education is so very important today."  Mr. Thomas' answer reads: "No, I don't.  I think there's not enough emphasis placed on sports.  More scholarships should be given in order to enable more persons to have a chance for higher education."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of John Smart wearing argyle sweater vest and hat, standing in front of textured wall, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Leon Thomas wearing zippered jacket, plaid shirt, and cap, standing in front of Sherwin Williams, Smithfield Street, Downtown
